Responding to the question from Labour's John Cryer ( Leyton and Wanstead) Mr Michael Gove said: It was, of course, deeply regrettable that any building projects had to be cancelled. "But the scale of the deficit we inherited meant cuts were inevitable and the inefficiency which characterised BSF schemes meant we needed a new approach. He said the six authorities had argued that the Government's decision making had been "confused and irrational" but the judge "makes clear the decisions I made were clear and rational".

it was Kenyon Martin 's defense that had coach George Karl talking. Allen Iverson had 36 points, Carmelo Anthony added 33 and Kenyon Martin shut down Toronto all-star Chris Bosh late as Denver rallied to beat the Toronto Raptors 109-100 on Sunday afternoon. Kenyon Martin 's defense on Chris Bosh was incredible and got better as the game went on, George Karl said. "You win games with stops more than making shots. frontman-- who has joined the TV talent show as a judge this season-- always believed years of hard work is a better way to become a star but knows times have changed. Mr Justice Holman, sitting in London, allowed challenges by six councils, including Sand-well, declaring Mr Michael Gove had unlawfully failed to consult them before the cuts. In five of the cases the failure was so unfair as to amount to an abuse of power, said the judge. He said: "However pressing the economic problems, there was no overriding public interest which precluded consultation or justifies the lack of any consultation." Mr Michael Gove 's decision-making

Although Allen Iverson 's two free throws with 17.1 seconds left were the difference in a 101-100 victory, Theo Ratliff 's season-high 25 points and George Lynch's basket over 7-foot-6 Shawn Bradley were pivotal, too. Theo Ratliff was demanding the ball and we had to get it to him the way he was putting it in the hole, 76ers guard Aaron McKie said. Philadelphia's three-game losing streak appeared likely to grow as Dallas took a 10-point lead early in the fourth quarter. But a layup by Theo Ratliff with 1:22 left tied it at 97. Steve Nash
